segment.source: Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) is a version of Windows 10 that is optimized for smaller devices with or without a display.
segment.target: Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) is a version of Windows 10 that is optimized for smaller devices with or without a display.

segment.source: IoT Core uses the rich, extensible Universal Windows Platform (UWP) API for building great solutions.
segment.target: IoT Core uses the rich, extensible Universal Windows Platform (UWP) API for building great solutions.

segment.source: IoT Core manufacturing
segment.target: IoT Core manufacturing

segment.source: IoT Core manufacturing
segment.target: IoT Core manufacturing

segment.source: Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) is a version of Windows 10 that is optimized for smaller devices with or without a display.
segment.target: Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) is a version of Windows 10 that is optimized for smaller devices with or without a display.

segment.source: IoT Core uses the rich, extensible Universal Windows Platform (UWP) API for building great solutions.
segment.target: IoT Core uses the rich, extensible Universal Windows Platform (UWP) API for building great solutions.

segment.source: OEMs can manufacture and deploy IoT Core using existing or custom-built hardware.
segment.target: OEMs can manufacture and deploy IoT Core using existing or custom-built hardware.

segment.source: To see hardware that's already supported, see Windows compatible hardware development boards and the Hardware Compatibility List.
segment.target: To see hardware that's already supported, see Windows compatible hardware development boards and the Hardware Compatibility List.

segment.source: When developing your own board, see the Minimum hardware requirements for IoT Core.
segment.target: When developing your own board, see the Minimum hardware requirements for IoT Core.

segment.source: IoT Core manufacturing guides
segment.target: IoT Core manufacturing guides

segment.source: This guide walks you through creating IoT Core images that can be flashed to retail devices and maintained after they have been delivered to your customers.
segment.target: This guide walks you through creating IoT Core images that can be flashed to retail devices and maintained after they have been delivered to your customers.

segment.source: IoT Core feature list
segment.target: IoT Core feature list

segment.source: Here's the features you can add to IoT Core images.
segment.target: Here's the features you can add to IoT Core images.

segment.source: Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons
segment.target: Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons

segment.source: The IoT Core ADK Add-Ons include tools to help you customize and create new images for your devices with the apps, board support packages (BSPs), drivers, and Windows features that you choose, and a sample structure you can use to quickly create new images.
segment.target: The IoT Core ADK Add-Ons include tools to help you customize and create new images for your devices with the apps, board support packages (BSPs), drivers, and Windows features that you choose, and a sample structure you can use to quickly create new images.

segment.source: IoT Core Add-ons command-line options
segment.target: IoT Core Add-ons command-line options

segment.source: These tools are part of the IoT Core ADK Add-Ons, in the \Tools folder.
segment.target: These tools are part of the IoT Core ADK Add-Ons, in the \Tools folder.

segment.source: To learn more about these tools, see Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons.
segment.target: To learn more about these tools, see Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons.
